body: as i said in discord, i don't repro your issue with my rtx 4090. The GPU usage reported is not a consistent metrics because the gpu clock varies, so you have to check at constant clock. In my pc, i see obs + nvidia filter at 30 % gpu usage (hags on or off) but gpu clock is at 800 MHz
more precisely, with hags off i have 10% gpu load but the frequency is tripled. So the real gpu load is about the same hags on or off

I’m not sure what’s wrong with my system then had the same issue with my 3090 just gonna stream with HAGS off

Get Outlook for iOS<https://aka.ms/o0ukef>
________________________________
From: pkv ***@***.***>
Sent: Saturday, October 22, 2022 10:47:03 AM
To: obsproject/obs-studio ***@***.***>
Cc: Spartanz1080 ***@***.***>; Author ***@***.***>
Subject: Re: [obsproject/obs-studio] NVIDIA Broadcast SDK with HAGS GPU Usage Bug (Issue #7639)


more precisely, with hags off i have 10% gpu load but the frequency is tripled. So the real gpu load is about the same hags on or off

—
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/issues/7639#issuecomment-1287868071>, or unsubscribe<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/A2T76OLC3M6DDY22MILTN5DWEQSBPANCNFSM6AAAAAARL5JJBE>.
You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Message ID: ***@***.***>
Regarding VRR instability it’s just with the gpu usage fluctuating fps changes causing VRR refresh to fluctuate which leads to perceived microstutter

So I have found a to deal with my issue. I downloaded the NVIDIA broadcast application and tried using that with OBS like it was in previous versions. The gpu usage is fine now and there is no issue with VRR in games anymore. The only way I can use the SDK is turn HAGS off but then I lose DLSS3. Is there some place I can go to submit feedback to NVIDIA on the SDK so maybe they can update it?

Ok i wonder if it might be fixed by my pr #7466 ;
Retrieve the artefact here:
https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/actions/runs/3316594645
Set the mask refresh slider to 2 instead of 1. 
The nvidia broadcast app refreshes at 30 fps while in obs the default is 60 fps.
This can cause stuttering under high gpu load.
The new slider will decrease for you the mask refresh frequency to 30 fps when set to 2.
This is great sorry though I am bit on how to install it and use it and find the setting.

Download the zip in any folder. It won't delete your current obs install.
Just run it from the unzipped folder in bin/64bit . You'll find obs.exe there.
If you create a shortcut for the exe with --portable it won't use your obs current settings but will start from clean slate.
It might be better in order start from a clean position.
So if i download that the flatpak and install it the mask setting will be 2 and I can uninstall as needed if I want use 2 also I thought there was a slider setting I had to find

No! Don't download the flatpak , it's a linux binary. Download the windows x64 zip.
When you add the nvidia background removal, you 'll see 1 new setting.
Set the mask refresh to 2.
Ok will it also be In microphone noise removal settings I’ll try it after work and report back. Thank you.
No, only for background removal which is the more demanding
I haven’t tested I’m at work I’m just wondering assuming it works will this feature make it into a release of OBS

> I haven’t tested I’m at work I’m just wondering assuming it works will this feature make it into a release of OBS

yes it 's planned

I made this same comment in discord but I’m just posting it here too. 

pkv you are god it works. For some reason even mask frequency 1 works. It goes all the way up to 4 so I’d like to know what that does. When I go back to normal OBS it does not work though. Also I’m not sure if something changed with microphone noise removal but it didn’t seem to be working as well as in normal OBS. Maybe it was my mic settings but it’s not a big deal it was just picking up some more noise. Anyway I’m extremely excited to get this into a future release. Thank you.

> I made this same comment in discord but I’m just posting it here too. 
> 
> pkv you are god it works. For some reason even mask frequency 1 works. It goes all the way up to 4 so I’d like to know what that does. When I go back to normal OBS it does not work though. Also I’m not sure if something changed with microphone noise removal but it didn’t seem to be working as well as in normal OBS. Maybe it was my mic settings but it’s not a big deal it was just picking up some more noise. Anyway I’m extremely excited to get this into a future release. Thank you.

Mmh. If it works with mask refresh = 1 , it's not my code which fixes your build. If you ran with --portable , i suspect it's the clean setup.
I replied on discord and did what you asked
I have a question on if changing mask settings affects the effectiveness of the SDK effects.

I have one last question if I update my normal OBS this will not update my zip version with the latest fixes and I have to wait until this feature is included in a beta before I can get updated fixes past 28.1 RC1 in the zip correct?

> I have one last question if I update my normal OBS this will not update my zip version with the latest fixes and I have to wait until this feature is included in a beta before I can get updated fixes past 28.1 RC1 in the zip correct? 

No.
The zip is separate. If you get update messages when running the zip, don't update or it'll remove the binaries.
You'll have to wait until end of November for 29 beta where it'll be in.
Fixed by https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/pull/7466

issue.title: obs-filters: Warn when NVIDIA FX needs update, Update to v0.7.1 Video SDK & Add a mask refresh slider

labels.name: Bug Fix
labels.description: Non-breaking change which fixes an issue

milestone.title: OBS Studio 29.0
milestone.description:
Items that we would like to consider for inclusion in OBS Studio 29.

NOTE: Items on this list are not promised to be in the listed release, just that we are considering them. This list is subject to change at any time.

repository.name: obs-studio
repository.description: OBS Studio - Free and open source software for live streaming and screen recording

issue.body:
### Description
This PR consists in three things:

1. Trying to mitigate an issue with NVIDIA Video & Audio FX sdks (which arises when updating one sdk and not the other).
2. Support v0.7.1.0+ Video FX sdk which improves Background Removal Filter by adding temporal processing.
3. Adding a mask refresh slider which controls how frequently the mask is refreshed.


### Motivation and Context

1. Context of the bug we are trying to mitigate: the NVIDIA Audio & Video Effects redistributable have been very recently updated (end of September 2022).
This can occasion bugs with obs-studio because the two redistributable rely on the same set of dependencies.
When one redistributable is more recent than the other, there can be a 'dll hell' with one of the two FX dll
being prevented from loading because the dependencies load but are the wrong ones for the other FX.
This is something which can not be solved on obs side but must be fixed by NVIDIA or the user.

- On the user side, the solution is to always upgrade both Video and Audio Effects redistributable at the same time. This is rendered a bit difficult because the versions of both SDKs have different numbers.
- On NVIDA side, an installer combining both Video & Audio FX would be one solution. Another would be to bundle the FX dlls with the GPU drivers.
On obs-studio side, we have implemented a detection of the dll versions and if they don't match a warning is issued in the Properties window of the filter.
Additionally the warning is logged.

2. Since Video Effects sdk v 0.7.0+, a major improvement is 'temporal processing' instead of a mere intraframe AI processing. This can improve the quality of the Background Removal filter. There is less flickering for instance.
We have added the capability to do temporal processing. But this will require the user to update to the latest sdk (as of Sept. 25). 
Back compatibility has been kept with earlier sdk should the user not want to upgrade.

3. The third feature (in the fourth commit) addresses one issue with the latest sdk (Video Effects sdk v 0.7.0+) which is much more demanding in terms of GPU processing than previous versions. For instance at 60 fps, obs can't always keep up if there's a demanding game (see also next section on tests for gory details) : there is rendering lag, which is detrimental. This is mitigated by leveraging the fact that it's not necessary to refresh the mask as frequently because usually we have a talking head who doesn't move too much. (This is an idea from Stephan Seitz, NVIDIA, whom I thank warmly.)
So we allow generating a mask every nth frame where n=1-4. For n=1, a mask is generated at each and every frame; for n=2, a mask is generated every two frames, etc ...
![obs64_2022-10-25_00-11-21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9283407/197640900-1cf390de-3c21-45b5-a6a1-9c36ea483006.png)


### How Has This Been Tested?
This was tested with an RTX 3070 FE with both last SDK and previous one.
All the Audio and Video FXs work fine.
This was also tested with an RTX 4090.
The redistributables can be found [here](https://www.nvidia.com/en-us/geforce/broadcasting/broadcast-sdk/resources/).
The audio files are provided by NVIDIA in their sdks.
To demo the dereverb FX, I have dramatized the effect by inserting a reverb vst in obs.

1. Audio FX:
   a. Denoiser (NVIDIA demo file played in obs + noise reduction filter with NVIDIA FX set to noise reduction): 


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9283407/192160933-8c1602dd-d308-4590-8318-4b24ae9efb5c.mp4

   b. Dereverb (NVIDIA demo file played in obs + reverb vst + noise reduction filter with NVIDIA FX set to dereverb): 

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9283407/192160936-52951685-e1b3-48a9-ba94-583ccc7a80b6.mp4


   c. Dereverb + Denoiser (NVIDIA demo file played in obs + reverb vst + noise reduction filter with NVIDIA FX set to dereverb+denoiser): 


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9283407/192160920-29d6e4a0-77af-402c-af9d-9d0203ae44a4.mp4

2. Video FX (Background Removal filter):

We checked that the filter still works after the changes in this PR with various types of sources.

- Browser-source:
![obs64_2022-09-25_20-35-26](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9283407/192161026-3eca3c43-d0ad-4999-a9ba-de5a263e194e.png)

- Video source:
![obs64_2022-09-25_20-40-52](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9283407/192161032-48b08abc-46ae-41df-82a2-75ff411bcd68.png)

- Still image:
![obs64_2022-09-25_20-35-40](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9283407/192161037-fd7e9b3b-cc19-44d0-b102-65b6ad530e7a.png)

- webcam (not shown).

3. Video FX (Background Removal filter) benchmark:
- I made extensive benchmarking of the effect by having obs and cyberpunk 2077 benchmark. Each figure in the table below corresponds to 5-10 runs of cyberpunk benchmark.
- hardware: RTX 4090 , 64 GB DDR4 , CPU: 5950x
- obs video settings: 1080p60 (720p60, 2k and 4k show similar results).

|   Setup | cyberpunk alone  | obs 28.0.3 | obs 28.0.3 + nv broadcast  |  obs 28.0.3 + fx quality  |  obs 28.0.3 + fx perf |  PR + fx quality  | PR + fx quality + skip 1 mask   | PR + fx quality + skip 2 masks   | PR + fx quality + skip 3 masks  | PR + fx perf  | PR + fx perf + skip 1 mask  |  PR + fx perf + skip 2 masks | 
|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---| 
|  FPS | 141.0±0.3  | 125.2±0.3  | 113.7±0.2  | 105.7±0.2  | 105.0±0.4  | 110.6±0.2 (obs: rendering lag)  | 119.3±0.2  | 123.8±0.1  | 125.5±0.3  | 114.2±0.1 (obs: rendering lag)   | 118.7±0.1  | 123.1±0.3  |  

The various setups:
- obs 28.0.3 + nv broadcast : cyberpunk benchmark + current release of obs + webcam video source using nvidia virtual webcam with background removal from NVIDIA Broadcast app.
- obs 28.0.3 + fx quality : current release of obs + webcam video source + background removal filter in Quality mode (better quality but higher gpu load).
- obs 28.0.3 + fx perf : current release of obs + webcam video source + background removal filter in Perf mode (good quality and lower gpu load).
- PR + fx quality : obs with current PR + webcam video source + background removal filter in Quality mode.
- PR + fx quality + skip 1 mask : obs with current PR + webcam video source + background removal filter in Quality mode + mask generated every two frames (one skips 1 frame between mask generation).
- PR + fx quality + skip 2 masks : obs with current PR + webcam video source + background removal filter in Quality mode + mask generated every three frames (one skips 2 frames between mask generation).
- PR + fx quality + skip 3 masks : obs with current PR + webcam video source + background removal filter in Quality mode + mask generated every four frames (one skips 3 frames between mask generation).
- PR + fx perf : obs with current PR + webcam video source + background removal filter in Perf mode.
- PR + fx perf + skip 1 mask : obs with current PR + webcam video source + background removal filter in Perf mode + mask generated every two frames (one skips 1 frame between mask generation).
- PR + fx perf + skip 2 masks : obs with current PR + webcam video source + background removal filter in Perf mode + mask generated every three frames (one skips 2 frames between mask generation).

Observations:
- one sees that Quality and Perf modes don't make much difference in terms of GPU load.
- the GPU load is higher with the PR which enables temporal processing.
- one finds that with the PR sdk update, obs starts to have some rendering lag and can't keep at 60 fps.
- this rendering lag disappears though if masks are not generated at every frame.
- the native integration of NVIDIA Background removal is more efficient than using NVIDIA Broadcast app if one allows mask generation every two frames (30 masks/sec at 60 fps). 

### Types of changes
- Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) 
- Performance enhancement (non-breaking change which improves efficiency)

### Checklist:
- [x] My code has been run through [clang-format](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/.clang-format).
- [x] I have read the [**contributing** document](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst).
- [x] My code is not on the master branch.
- [x] The code has been tested.
- [x] All commit messages are properly formatted and commits squashed where appropriate.
- [x] I have included updates to all appropriate documentation.
